title: Romantic Valentine proposal page with evasive No button and meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single-screen, romantic-themed Valentine proposal page that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and presents exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... to ask her to be my Valentine.
There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the user sees the question "Will you be my Valentine?" and exactly two buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".
The page has no additional primary actions beyond the Yes/No choice.

requirements.text: Implement an evasive "No" button interaction: when the user attempts to hover or otherwise interact with the "No" button (e.g., pointer enter / touch start), it moves to a new position so it cannot be clicked.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop browsers, moving the cursor onto the "No" button causes it to relocate immediately.
On touch devices (including iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the "No" button causes it to relocate before a click/tap is registered.
The "No" button never relocates off-screen; it remains fully visible and within the viewport after each move.
The user cannot successfully click/tap the "No" button under normal use because it moves away on interaction.

requirements.text: When the user clicks "Yes", replace the choice UI with a confirmation view that displays a meme image and the message "Good choice".

quotes:
When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her
"Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "Yes" button hides or disables both buttons and shows a result state.
The result state includes the exact text "Good choice" (English, matching capitalization and spacing).
The result state displays the provided/generated meme image clearly on both desktop and iPad Chrome.

requirements.text: Apply a romantic pink-and-white theme across the page (background, typography, buttons, spacing) with a clean, simple layout optimized for iPad Chrome.

quotes:
The page should be themed
romantically with a pink and white color scheme
...so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: The dominant colors used are pink and white; the overall styling reads as romantic and minimal.
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad-sized viewports in Chrome (no horizontal scrolling; key content fits on screen).
Animations/transitions (if any) are smooth and do not block interaction.

requirements.text: Add the generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend (not via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The app references the static asset path directly and it loads in the browser without backend involvement.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Frontend must be implemented in the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind stack (compose existing UI components; do not modify immutable paths).
No backend canister changes are required for this feature.
nonGoals: Persisting user choices or tracking analytics.
Multi-page routing or additional features beyond the Valentine prompt and its interactions.

required: Romantic meme-style image with the text "Good choice" in a bold, high-contrast meme caption style on a pink/white themed background (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)
